intro: Reevesia pubescens var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy Reevesia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Reevesia pubescens var. pubescens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
